sentence.Network_en: They have both behaved very badly and I am very hurt.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们俩都很不友善，让我非常难过。

sentence.Network_en: The European Parliament badly needs a president who can burnish its image.
sentence.Network_cn: 欧洲议会急需一位能改善其声望的主席。

sentence.Network_en: He had wrenched his ankle badly from the force of the fall.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因摔倒而严重扭伤了脚踝。

list.abs: 高三英语单词列表_百度知道 ... taxpayer  n. 纳税人 badly  off 潦倒；穷困 occupy  vt. 使忙碌；使从事；占有.

受重伤的英语翻译 - 已解决 - 搜搜问问 ... 受重伤的1. maimed 使受重伤1. badly hurt 侥幸没受重伤1. escaped serious injury.
是说得不好 (speaking badly)：但没有按照语用原则来处理话语。

entry.def: If something is done badly or goes badly, it is not very successful or effective.

example.ex: I was angry because I played so badly...
example.tran: 我很生气，因为自己的表现实在是太差了。

example.ex: The whole project was badly managed...

entry.def: If someone or something is badly hurt or badly affected, they are severely hurt or affected.

example.ex: The bomb destroyed a police station and badly damaged a church...
example.tran: 炸弹摧毁了一处警察局，并使一座教堂严重受损。

example.ex: One man was killed and another badly injured...

entry.def: If you want or need something badly, you want or need it very much.

example.ex: Why do you want to go so badly?...
Planes landed at Bagram airport today carrying badly needed food and medicine.
example.tran: 运载急需食物和药品的飞机今天在巴格拉姆机场降落。

entry.tran: 不友好地；令人不快地；恶劣地
entry.def: If someone behaves badly or treats other people badly, they act in an unkind, unpleasant, or unacceptable way.

example.ex: They have both behaved very badly and I am very hurt...
example.tran: 他们俩都很不友善，让我非常难过。

example.ex: I would like to know why we pensioners are being so badly treated.
example.tran: 我想知道为什么我们这些领养老金的人受到如此恶劣的对待。

entry.tran: 不利地；负面地；有损名声地
entry.def: If something reflects badly on someone or makes others think badly of them, it harms their reputation.

example.ex: Teachers know that low exam results will reflect badly on them...
example.tran: 老师知道考试成绩不好将对他们不利。

example.ex: The male sex comes out of the film very badly...
example.tran: 这部影片中男性的形象非常负面。

entry.def: If a person or their job is badly paid, they are not paid very much for what they do.

example.ex: You may have to work part-time, in a badly paid job with unsociable hours...
example.tran: 你或许只能做个薪水低、非正常工作时间上班的兼职。

example.ex: This is the most dangerous professional sport there is, and the worst paid.
example.tran: 这是最危险的职业体育运动，但报酬却是最低的。

means.word_mean: 1. to a severe or serious degree;

sentences.sentence: "fingers so badly frozen they had to be amputated"

means.word_mean: 2. (`ill' is often used as a combining form) in a poor or improper or unsatisfactory manner; not well;

sentences.sentence: "it ill befits a man to betray old friends"

means.word_mean: 4. in a disobedient or naughty way;

sentences.sentence: "he mischievously looked for a chance to embarrass his sister"
"behaved naughtily when they had guests and was sent to his room"

means.word_mean: 5. with great intensity (`bad' is a nonstandard variant for `badly');

sentences.sentence: "I wanted it badly enough to work hard for it"
"they were badly in need of help"
"he wants a bicycle so bad he can taste it"

means.word_mean: 7. without skill or in a displeasing manner;
8. in a disadvantageous way; to someone's disadvantage;

sentences.sentence: "the venture turned out badly for the investors"
"angry that the case was settled disadvantageously for them"
"tried not to speak ill of the dead"
"thought badly of him for his lack of concern"

means.word_mean: 10. with unusual distress or resentment or regret or emotional display;

sentences.sentence: "conducted himself very badly at the time of the earthquake"

auth_sentence.content: Females can come off quite badly in these scenarios.
auth_sentence.res_content: Females can come off quite badly in these scenarios.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Females can come off quite badly in these scenarios.

auth_sentence.content: But their misjudgement came to rebound on them badly.
auth_sentence.res_content: But their misjudgement came to rebound on them badly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But their misjudgement came to rebound on them badly.

auth_sentence.content: They have reacted badly to their change in fortunes.
auth_sentence.res_content: They have reacted badly to their change in fortunes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They have reacted badly to their change in fortunes.

Sentence.sentence: If you were doing badly, having an audience increases the chances that you will continue to do badly
The research argued that boys often perform badly in mixed schools because they become discouraged when their female peers do better earlier in speaking and reading skills.

means.word_mean: 坏, 差, 拙劣地,不认真仔细

sentences.en: He judged the present situation badly.
sentences.cn: 他很糟糕地错估了当前形势。

means.word_mean: 非常, 在很大程度上

jushi.english: I really need that job more badly than you.
jushi.chinese: 我真的比你更需要那份工作。
